title: [K-12] Patient Education Simulation Design for Pre-Cardiac Revascularization Surgery

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of medical terminology and foundational knowledge of human physiology
context.additional_context: A medical communication scenario-based education course for language majors.

learning_goals: Students can accurately explain over 80% of core information related to cardiac revascularization, including surgical procedures, precautions, and recovery processes.
Students successfully perform role-plays applying effective patient-healthcare provider communication strategies three times consecutively.
When organizing patient education materials via mobile application interface design, all five elements of the Pasquali criteria are incorporated.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
